name: Black Horse
description:
Artist: Abigail Reed

Title: Black Horse

Date: 2013

Dimensions: 50cm x 50cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm. 

Edition Size: 50

Details:
This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an ink on paper drawing by Abigail.

Description:
Abigail Reed’s paintings and drawings portray the human and animal form, the strength these figures embody and the impact they have on their surroundings.

Animals poised in their ultimate state, stand like statues demanding your attention. As you look through the layers of pencil, charcoal, ink and paint the medium has been allowed to flow, nothing is fixed. Dripping, bleeding and cracking revealing its accidental, volatile nature, a beginning and an end, from darkness to light. The subjects are exposed, unveiling something primal, vulnerable; penetrating a raw truth.

Abigail received a First class BA Hons in Fine Art from The University Of Wales Institute of Cardiff in 2004 and now works from her Jamaica Street Studio in Bristol. In 2010 Abigail had her first solo exhibition at the Knifesmith Gallery and her solo shows this year include the Folk House Cafe and Urban Outfitters store also in Bristol. Abigail has also recently appeared at No.1 Harbourside, Royal West of England Academy, and JSA Open Studios Weekend. Her previous successes include several Lead Artist shows at Bay Art in Cardiff.

Original works by Abigail are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:
jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Ravens Wrapping paper
description:
Wrapping paper designed and screen printed by Rebecca Hiscocks.

Comes in dark blue on cream or black on white. 

£2.50 per sheet in physical shop in Bristol.

5 sheets for £10 online (fifth sheet free)

This listing is for 5 sheets.

name: Persephone
description:
Artist: Sarah Jeffs

Title: Demeter

Dimensions: 50 x 50 cm

Medium: Photographic print, printed on Fuji Flex paper

Details: 
Sarah experiments with photographic techniques under constructed studio conditions to create beautiful and mysterious objects and scenes.

This work is part of the ‘Crystalline Planet Series’. It depicts a microcosm of the immense expanses of space and cosmic events which it represents. These long exposure photographs of amethyst, quartz and crystal geode lit in different ways are combined using photo montage to create distinctive and unique new realities.

Representations of the vast are in juxtaposition with a process that takes place on a small scale recreating the epic in miniature. 

Sarah’s photographs are printed on to super high gloss paper producing a hyper real almost luminescent final image.

To find our more about Sarah's work please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Punch and the Blinded
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: Punch and the Blinded

Date: 2013

Dimensions: 41 cm x 58.5 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Tim Lane.

Description:

Here Tim reimagines a Punch and Judy show. The character of Punch was often used to voice opinions that would otherwise be prohibited, satirising politicians, for example.  The darker subtext of the material combined with the explicit violence turns this children’s puppet show into something much more sinister. 

Tim’s anachronistic style takes especially strong influence from classic literature and mythologies. Although Tim’s background is in illustration he now concentrates on fine art painting and drawing, in which he enjoys greater creative freedom in terms of both style and subject matter. Illustration has however helped to give structure to his love for working directly from his imagination and gives his art its narrative quality. It has also encouraged a passion for drawing, which is at the core of all his work.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Dark Suits - Playing Cards
description:
Artist: Mr Mead

Title: Dark Suits Playing Cards

Date: 2011

Details:

Printed by a professional card producer these cards come in a box designed by the artist. The 52 cards are supplemented by two Jokers and an extra four cards telling the story of each suit family.

Description:

Mr Mead has created his own edition of playing cards. Each card is adorned with one of his 'Bio-Anthropomorphic' characters. The four suits have been adopted by different groups; Birds have adopted the Hearts, Horned Beasts the Diamonds, Foxes the Clubs and Cats the Spades.

Mr Mead’s terror and intrigue for animals dressed as humans stems from his childhood. Deciding to embrace his fear, he has developed his ink based style to create dark inhuman characters blending the animal, human and mechanic, a practice he nicknames ‘Bio-Mechanical Anthropomorphism’.

After studying Animation in Bournmouth, Mr Mead went onto develop his traditional drawing practice. He currently works from Jamaica Street Studios in Bristol and regularly exhibits with Antlers, including his solo project - Dark Suits in April 2011.

Original works by Mr Mead are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: White Rose I
description:
Artist: Charles Emerson

Title: White Rose I

Dimensions: 75cm x 56cm

Medium: Photographic Print, printed with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks onto 271gsm Oyster Photo Paper

Edition size :- 50

Description:

Charles creates photographs that experiment with the boundaries between painting and photography. This work captures the moment in which a flower is submerged in water and inks.

Charles' flower series draws on the composition and lighting values of still life paintings. Influenced by the use of symbolism in Dutch Vanitas, Charles has created his own symbolic imagery, in which he explores ideas of fragility in life, death and the hereafter. 

This work features on Editors' new 2013 album 'The Weight of Your Love.'

More works by Charles are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Jacob's Dream
description:
Artist: Matthieu Leger

Title: Jacob's Dream

Dimensions: 72 x 43cm

Medium: Innova Soft Textured Natural White 315gsm and Ultra Chrome Epsom Inks

Details: 
Matthieu Leger’s work explores ideas of the creative psychological space. Navigating world history, symbols, semiotics and metaphor, Matthieu presents us with fabricated imaginary places not bound to the confines of our given reality.

Presented almost as multi-layered maps, puzzles or cyphers, waiting to be solved, Matthieu’s work allows for a mysterious, imaginative and open interpretation to unfold within the viewer.

In this work lines and forms are nonsensical, and the enigmatic figure standing stout on the distorted triangle, although central seems lost within the rest of the imagery. This leads to perplexing ideas questioning the relationship between the presence of the figure and the rest of the composition.

Original works by Matthieu are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Matriarch
description:
Artist: Ellie Coates

Title: Matriarch

Date: 2013

Dimensions: 20 cm x 20 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Somerset Velvet Natural White 330gsm. Hand titled with gold. 

Edition Size: 50

Details:
This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a pencil drawing by Ellie Coates.

Description:
Through the work of Ellie Coates the viewer is invited into the timeless world of story telling. Combining inspiration drawn from myths, folklore and Renaissance painting she creates the props with which to encourage the imagination of the viewer to weave the narrative.

Ellie graduated with a First Class degree in Drawing and Applied Arts at the University of the West of England.

Original works by Ellie are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:
jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Hello From Everywhere 3D
description:
Artist: Geoff Diego Litherland

Title: Hello From Everywhere 3D

Dimensions: 30cm x 30cm

Medium: Giclee Print

Details: 
Geoff’s work explores the tension between the natural world and its grasping appropriation by human influence. It draws from traditional genres of painting together with the rusty surrealism of science fiction and the fantasia of abstraction to create a parallel world that seeks to not only question our perception of and relationship to nature, but paintings’ historical and current role in that.

This work is a 3D digital print and the image comes to life when viewed through a set of red/blue 3D glasses. The landscape is depicted as a microcosm suspended in the vast plethora of outer space. His use of stark red and blue tones contrast with the hazy image of the earthy colours of the landscape.

Original works by Geoff are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Storm
description:
Artist: Max Naylor

Title: Storm

Dimensions: 41cm x 35cm

Medium: Original intaglio etching, Hahnemuhle etching paper

Edition Size: 40

Details:
This original etching is one of a series of studies of the sea created by Max during his postgraduate study.

Description:
Max’s drawings explore the relationship between external and internal spaces through imagery made from a mixture of memory and imagination. 

The use of differing levels of intensity is important in the images Max creates, in terms of mark making and in terms of decision making. Trying to balance close detail and planned composition with expressive doodling and instinctive choices.

“My visual memory is full of landscapes that are an invaluable resource when making work, I sometimes try to accurately represent a remembered view or take component parts to construct an imagined place. This seems to me a very natural process, the act of picking up a pen and marking out a skyline becomes almost an unconscious one.”

Max has studied at Falmouth College of Art (Foundation), the University of Brighton (BA Fine Art) and has recently finished a post graduate course at the Prince’s Drawing School, London (2012). Max has been part of numerous group shows including those in Bristol, London, Truro, Brighton and Tuscany. Max has had solo shows at the MAC Birmingham, Mind-scapes (2011) and Gallery 49, Falmouth (2004). Max has been short-listed for the National Open Art Competition, Chichester and the Jerwood Drawing Prize.

Original works by Max are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Three Peaks Rising
description:
Artist: Anouk Mercier 

Title: Three Peaks Rising 

Date: 2012

Dimensions:  25 cm x 17.5 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a mixed media work by Anouk Mercier. In the original work Anouk used a variety of media including: airbrush, fine liner, colour pencil, graphite and acetone transfer.

Print Launch: 

This limited edition print was launched to coincide with Anouk Mercier's first UK solo-show - Excursus which took place July 2012. 
http://www.antlersgallery.com/project/excursus

Collection: 

If you would like to collect the print from Antlers HQ in Cabot Circus, please select Andorra as shipping destination and you will not be charged for postage. 

Description:

Celebrating the power of imagination to escape the quotidian and the mundane, Anouk’s work prompts the creation of narratives by encouraging the viewer to follow the paths of these fantastical landscapes.

After studying at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Beaux Arts in Paris, Anouk went on to read Art and Visual Culture at UWE, Bristol. In 2008 she won the Innes Wilkin Art in Architecture Prize and since has gone on to exhibit in a number of group shows including exhibitions at the RWA, Spike Island and the Bristol Drawing School. 

In 2011 she had her first solo-show in France – Clemancy,  and won the Emerging Artist Prize for the RWA Autumn Exhibition.  This year, as well as her solo-show with Antlers Gallery she is also working on a commission for the Bristol City Museum’s permanent collection and is part of a group exhibition curated by Paul O’ Neill at the London gallery, Cartel.

For more details on her solo-show - Excursus please see: 
http://www.antlersgallery.com/project/excursus

Original works by Anouk are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Winter Barn
description:
Artist: Kate Evans 

Title: Winter Barn

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Original works by Kate are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

name: The Uninvited Guest
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: The Uninvited Guest

Date: 2009

Dimensions: 40 x 40 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an acrylic on canvas painting by Tim Lane.

Description:

This painting is from a series of works by Tim Lane called ‘Bacchanalia’ The bacchanalia were wild and mystic festivals of the Roman god Bacchus: the wine god. The term has since come to describe any form of drunken revelry. This series of small-scale works takes as loose inspiration this Classical festival of ultimate decadence and animalistic pleasure.

Here, the revellers are seen on their way to a modern fancy dress party wearing costumes and carrying attributes reflective of their own inner hopes, dreams and fears on their journey through life

As with the ‘Memento Mori’ series, ideas about the eventuality of death recur. However, ‘The Uninvited Guest’ here serves as a reminder to live despite his inescapable arrival at the party. 

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

The tea: Energising Oolong Tea with ginger cinnamon and lemmongrass. Comes in a pouch with five 'make-your-own' T-bags.

name: Butterfly Doe
description:
Artist: Amy Timms

Title: Butterfly Doe

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 35 cm x 46 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition size :- 50

Limited Edition Print

Details:

This print is a high quality reproduction of a gouache painting on Fabriano paper, produced for the Antlers exhibition Grotesques, 2010.

Description:

A fallow doe lies fallen upon the ground. As her body decays and returns to the earth, butterflies come forth to feed from her, taking up valuable minerals and salts. So, from death springs life.

Amy’s paintings aim to convey the pure essence or souls of the animals they represent, weaving in a subtle narrative of birth, love, death and decay. Working primarily in bold, flat gouache, Amy takes her inspiration from British folklore and superstitions as well as the shamanic traditions of Native American medicine. Presently, she is also studying the art of taxidermy, which unites both her love of art and anatomy.

Amy is a Bristol based artist. Originally from Wiltshire, her rural upbringing helped to fuel her fascination for the natural world, principally her interest in the indigenous flora and fauna of the British Isles. She graduated in 2007 from Falmouth College of Arts with a BA (Hons) Illustration.

Original works by Amy are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Foxfire
description:
Artist: Amy Timms

Title: Foxfire

Date: 2011

Dimensions: 50 cm x 50 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This print is a high quality reproduction of a gouache painting on silver birch paper, produced in 2011.

Description: 

A corpse of a fox lies curled, as if in sleep. Fungi, grows forth from its decaying body, casting a soft, phosphorescent glow known as Foxfire. Insects gather round to feed from both fungi and fox. Entwining a forepaw a blue ribbon symbolises tranquillity and the peace found in a natural death. And so it is, that the fox moths, moth larvae, fungi and foxfire are all united through the very fox itself.

Amy’s paintings aim to convey the pure essence or souls of the animals that they represent. Working primarily in bold, flat gouache, the interplay between colour and negative space of her neutral backgrounds is key.

Amy is a Bristol based artist. Originally from Wiltshire, her pastoral upbringing has fuelled her fascination for the natural world. She graduated in 2007 from Falmouth College of Arts with a BA (Hons) degree in Illustration. She has exhibited at Chelsea Flower Show 2007, Grotesques 2010 at Antlers Gallery Bristol and The Royal West of England Academy 2011. Her work is on permanent display onboard the Cunard Queen Victoria.

name: Deliberation
description:
Artist: Rose Sanderson

Title: Deliberation

Date: 2012

Dimensions: 52cm x 52cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 20

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a  reproduction of a Acrylic / Mixed Media painting by Rose Sanderson. 

Description:

Rose is inspired by the natural world, especially that which is generally unnoticed or disregarded by others. This current series of work focuses predominantly on the fragility of life and representations of freedom. Rose's delicate, yet expressive paintings aim to provoke in an understated way; producing pieces that are empathetic, fresh and intriguing.

Based in Bristol, Rose has exhibited in a number of locations including London, Bath, Brighton, Plymouth, Glasgow, Amsterdam, Brussels, New York and Singapore. Originally an illustrator, completing her BA(hons) in 2003, she is now a recognised artist within the fine art world.

Original works by Rose are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Chalet (no.4)
description:
Artist: Anouk Mercier

Title: Chalet (no.4)

Date: 2011

Dimensions: 40 cm x 30 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition size: 25

Details:

This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of watercolour, colour pencil and graphite on paper drawing by Anouk Mercier.

Description:

This series of chalet pictures demonstrates Anouk’s continuous search for escapism through the portrayal of a fragmented, yet beautiful, ideal, whilst also exploring the mysterious, the abysmal and the uncanny that often lurks behind such idylls. 

Celebrating the power of imagination to escape the quotidian and the mundane, Anouk’s drawings prompt the creation of narratives by encouraging the viewer to follow the paths of these fantastical landscapes.

After studying at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Beaux Arts in Paris, Anouk went on to read Art and Visual Culture at UWE, Bristol. In 2008 she won the Innes Wilkin Art in Architecture Prize and since has gone on to exhibit in a number of group shows including exhibitions at the RWA, Spike Island and the Bristol Drawing School. In June 2011 Anouk had her first solo exhibition at La Galerie, Clamecy, France.

Original works by Anouk are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: In Style Crocodile
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: In Style Crocodile

Date: 2009

Dimensions: 30 cm x 30 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an acrylic on canvas painting by Tim Lane.

Description:

This painting is from a series of works by Tim Lane called ‘Bacchanalia’ The bacchanalia were wild and mystic festivals of the Roman god Bacchus.  The term has since come to describe any form of drunken revelry. This series of small-scale works takes as loose inspiration this classical festival of ultimate decadence and animalistic pleasure. 

Here, the revellers are seen on their way to a modern fancy dress party wearing costumes and carrying attributes reflective of their own inner hopes, dreams and fears on their journey through life. The shy boy making his way to the party in the guise of a ferocious crocodile shows a contrast between the outward projection of confidence and aggression, and an inner fragility.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

name: This Moment After
description:
Artist: Charles Emerson

Title: This Moment After

Dimensions: 60 x 60 cm

Medium: Photographic Print, printed with Ultrachrome 
Pigment Inks onto Gold Fibre Silk 310gsm
Edition size :- 20

Description:

This work is from Charles' BLACKLIGHT series released October 2013.

Emerson’s photography captures a particular moment in his studio, everything you see within the exhibition happened and is real. He constructs a set using a tank, water, glass plates, mirrors and coloured and UV lights. Flowers are submerged in the tank as the core of each piece, Emerson then introduces inks, dyes and paints to imbue the scene with a sense of movement and life. It is this decisive moment which Emerson captures within his photography.

Each print is signed, titled and editioned by the artist and accompanied by a Certificate of Authenticity.

Prices are subject to periodic increase as the edition sells out.

More works by Charles are available, to find out more please contact Jack on: 
jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Demeter
description:
Artist: Sarah Jeffs

Title: Demeter

Dimensions: 50 x 50 cm

Medium: Photographic print, printed on Fuji Flex paper

Details: 
Sarah experiments with photographic techniques under constructed studio conditions to create beautiful and mysterious objects and scenes.

This work is part of the  ‘Crystalline Planet Series’. It depicts a microcosm of the immense expanses of space and cosmic events which it represents. These long exposure photographs of amethyst, quartz and crystal geode lit in different ways are combined using photo montage to create distinctive and unique new realities.

Representations of the vast are in juxtaposition with a process that takes place on a small scale recreating the epic in miniature.

Sarah’s photographs are printed on to super high gloss paper producing a hyper real almost luminescent final image.

To find our more about Sarah's work please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Cliffs
description:
Artist: Max Naylor

Title: Cliffs

Dimensions: 30cm x 48cm

Medium: Original intaglio etching, Hahnemuhle etching paper
Edition Size: 40

Details: 
This original etching is one of a series of studies of the sea created by Max during his postgraduate study.

Description: 
Max’s drawings explore the relationship between external and internal spaces through imagery made from a mixture of memory and imagination.

The use of differing levels of intensity is important in the images Max creates, in terms of mark making and in terms of decision making. Trying to balance close detail and planned composition with expressive doodling and instinctive choices.

“My visual memory is full of landscapes that are an invaluable resource when making work, I sometimes try to accurately represent a remembered view or take component parts to construct an imagined place. This seems to me a very natural process, the act of picking up a pen and marking out a skyline becomes almost an unconscious one.”

Max has studied at Falmouth College of Art (Foundation), the University of Brighton (BA Fine Art) and has recently finished a post graduate course at the Prince’s Drawing School, London (2012). Max has been part of numerous group shows including those in Bristol, London, Truro, Brighton and Tuscany. Max has had solo shows at the MAC Birmingham, Mind-scapes (2011) and Gallery 49, Falmouth (2004). Max has been short-listed for the National Open Art Competition, Chichester and the Jerwood Drawing Prize.

Original works by Max are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: The Fruits of Sacrifice
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: The Fruits of Sacrifice

Date: 2012

Dimensions: 39cm x 49cm

Medium: Giclee Print

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an acrylic on canvas painting by Tim Lane.

Description:

Tim’s anachronistic style takes especially strong influence from classic literature and mythologies. Although Tim’s background is in illustration he now concentrates on fine art painting and drawing, in which he enjoys greater creative freedom in terms of both style and subject matter. Illustration has however helped to give structure to his love for working directly from his imagination and gives his art its narrative quality. It has also encouraged a passion for drawing, which is at the core of all his work.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Nectarivore
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: Nectarivore 

Date: 2012

Dimensions: Width: 59.4 cm (A2) Height: 29.5cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:
This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an ink on paper drawing by Tim Lane.

Description:

This drawing was commissioned by Antlers gallery to appear on a fine bone china mug they produced in collaboration with the artist. 

The drawing is a continuation of a  series of works by Tim Lane called ‘Bacchanalia’ The bacchanalia were wild and mystic festivals of the Roman god Bacchus: the wine god. The term has since come to describe any form of drunken revelry. This series of small scale works takes as loose inspiration this Classical festival of ultimate decadence and animalistic pleasure.

The revellers are seen on their way to a modern fancy dress party wearing costumes and carrying attributes reflective of their own inner hopes, dreams and fears on their journey through life. 

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration. Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery, ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol. Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on: jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: St Bart's Dentistry Piece
description:
Artist: Rebecca Hiscocks

Title: St Bart's Dentistry Piece

Date: 2012

Dimensions: 42 cm x 59.5 cm

Medium: Giclee Print

Edition Size: 25

Description: 

Rebecca Hiscocks finds inspiration in the bizarre and the macabre, her intricate and detailed compositions reflect London's uncanny and unusual past. Through a fascination of the internal workings of the body she has recently been researching stories about St Bartholomews and St Thomas hospitals, looking closely at the 18th century etchings of anatomical pioneer William Cheselden in order to inform her visual narrative.

Rebecca uses a combination of architectural decoration and a muted pallet in order to create a softness and beauty as a contrast to the invasiveness of surgery.

Rebecca recently graduated from the University of the Arts, London with an MA in Illustration. She is currently based in London and has been lecturing in illustration and print since 2001. She is currently working with the Wellcome Collection, creating votive paintings in the form of illustrations for members of the public who wish to give thanks to people who have averted disaster in their lives.

name: Living Echo II
description:
Artist: Rachel Sokal 

Title: Living Echo II 

Date: 2012

Dimensions: 42 cm x 29.7 cm (A3)

Medium: Giclée Print on Museum Grade Quality Paper 

Edition size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a photograph which as been printed on a leaf using only sunlight. 

Collection: 

If you would like to collect the print from Antlers HQ in Cabot Circus, or our show in Stroud please select Andorra as shipping destination and you will not be charged for postage. 

Description:

Living Echo is Rachel’s current body of work and the culmination of two years of experimentation. These are photos printed onto leaves using only sunlight.

By placing a photo printed onto clear acetate over a leaf, then exposing it to the sun for several days, the leaf itself takes on the image. Where the acetate image cast a protective shadow over areas of the leaf, it stays a healthy green or darker brown. Where the sun shines through the clear highlights of the image overlay, it damages the leaf rather in a similar way to our own skin, though drying and bleaching rather than darkening it. The leaf is still alive as the photo develops into its cellular structure; only drying once the process is over and the photo overlay is lifted away. Just as the leaf itself had a lifespan, so does the image now printed onto it. Rachel’s chlorophyll prints are purposely left ‘unfixed’ and chemical free. This means the images continue their slow change whenever they are exposed to sunlight, slowly bleaching and disappearing forever.

This Limited Edition Print of the original photograph has been launched by Antlers to coincide with their show - Old Beliefs

name: Resting Soul
description:
Artist: Rose Sanderson

Title: Resting Soul

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 21 cm x 29.5 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 20

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a  reproduction of a Acrylic / Mixed Media painting by Rose Sanderson. 

Description:

The things that are generally disregarded in the world around her are of great influence to Rose’s work. Where some may see ugliness, disgust or distaste, Rose sees beauty and intrigue. 

The object of death is seen not as a morbid obsession created to shock or offend but as an appreciation of what once was: to honour and celebrate its existence. Expressive backgrounds that give a feeling of decay (peeling layers of wallpaper, cracked surfaces, aged and ‘distressed’) are combined with fine attention to detail in the subject matter, producing a vibrant mixture of traditional and experimental techniques.

Rose is a Bristol based artist who graduated in 2003 from The University of the West of England with a BA (hons) degree in Illustration. Since then, her work has steadily progressed towards fine art painting, allowing her more creative freedom. She has exhibited in numerous shows spread across Bristol, Bath, London, Plymouth, Glasgow, Amsterdam, Brussels, New York and Singapore.

Original works by Rose are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Stag
description:
Artist: Amy Timms

Title: Stag

Date: 2009

Dimensions: 46 cm x 35 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This print is a high quality reproduction of a gouache painting on Fabriano paper, produced in 2009.

Description:

A stag stares nonchalantly at the viewer. He is the king of the hinds, adorned with ribbons and jewels and crowned with a magpies nest, yet he is indifferent to all this finery. 

Amy’s paintings aim to convey the pure essence or souls of the animals they represent, weaving in a subtle narrative of birth, love, death and decay. Working primarily in bold, flat gouache, Amy takes her inspiration from British folklore and superstitions as well as the shamanic traditions of Native American medicine. Presently, she is also studying the art of taxidermy, which unites both her love of art and anatomy.

Amy is a Bristol based artist. Originally from Wiltshire, her rural upbringing helped to fuel her fascination for the natural world, principally her interest in the indigenous flora and fauna of the British Isles. She graduated in 2007 from Falmouth College of Arts with a BA (Hons) Illustration.

Original works by Amy are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

Edition size: 25

Details:

This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a mixed media work by Anouk Mercier. In the original work Anouk used a variety of media including: airbrush, fine liner, colour pencil, graphite and acetone transfer.

Print Launch: 

This limited edition print was launched to coincide with Anouk Mercier's first UK solo-show - Excursus which took place in July 2012. 

http://www.antlersgallery.com/project/excursus

Collection: 

If you would like to collect the print from Antlers HQ in Cabot Circus, please select Andorra as shipping destination and you will not be charged for postage. 

Description:

Celebrating the power of imagination to escape the quotidian and the mundane, Anouk’s work prompts the creation of narratives by encouraging the viewer to follow the paths of these fantastical landscapes.

After studying at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Beaux Arts in Paris, Anouk went on to read Art and Visual Culture at UWE, Bristol. In 2008 she won the Innes Wilkin Art in Architecture Prize and since has gone on to exhibit in a number of group shows including exhibitions at the RWA, Spike Island and the Bristol Drawing School. 

In 2011 she had her first solo-show in France – Clemancy,  and won the Emerging Artist Prize for the RWA Autumn Exhibition.  This year, as well as her solo-show with Antlers Gallery she is also working on a commission for the Bristol City Museum’s permanent collection and is part of a group exhibition curated by Paul O’ Neill at the London gallery, Cartel.

For more details on her solo-show - Excursus please see: 
http://www.antlersgallery.com/project/excursus

Original works by Anouk are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

Rose's delicate, yet expressive paintings aim to provoke in an understated way; producing pieces that are empathetic, fresh and intriguing.

Based in Bristol, Rose has exhibited in a number of locations including London, Bath, Brighton, Plymouth, Glasgow, Amsterdam, Brussels, New York and Singapore. Originally an illustrator, completing her BA(hons) in 2003, she is now a recognised artist within the fine art world.

Original works by Rose are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

name: Fall
description:
Artist: Amy Timms

Title: Fall

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 35 cm x 46 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition size :- 50

Limited Edition Print

Details:

This print is a high quality reproduction of a gouache painting finished in 2012

Description:

A fox lies fallen upon the ground. The body decays and returns to the earth, with fruiting bodies of fungi sprouting from her, taking up valuable minerals and salts.

Amy’s paintings aim to convey the pure essence or souls of the animals they represent, weaving in a subtle narrative of birth, love, death and decay. Working primarily in bold, flat gouache, Amy takes her inspiration from British folklore and superstitions as well as the shamanic traditions of Native American medicine. Presently, she is also studying the art of taxidermy, which unites both her love of art and anatomy.

Amy is a Bristol based artist. Originally from Wiltshire, her rural upbringing helped to fuel her fascination for the natural world, principally her interest in the indigenous flora and fauna of the British Isles. She graduated in 2007 from Falmouth College of Arts with a BA (Hons) Illustration.

Original works by Amy are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Butterfly Beat
description:
Artist: Amy Timms

Title: Butterfly Beat

Date: 2011

Dimensions:  35 cm x 35 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This print is a high quality reproduction of a gouache painting on silver birch paper, produced in 2011.

Description: 


Butterfly Beat is first of two works in which Amy has based upon the anatomical studies of a red deer’s respiratory organs.

In this piece a heart and lungs lie in a pool of blood, surrounded by butterflies. An indigo ribbon binds the heart, restraining its beats.  With its trachea hanging limply to one side, the lungs are dull, dark and constrained, unable to inflate. A heart is a symbol frequently associated with the theme of love, however in this case the concept of love is restrained. The dominance of the heart holds the lungs back, preventing them from having the space to breath.

With their wings echoing that of the form of the bow, butterflies swarm over the organs, creating an air of closeness and claustrophobia. This is heightened by the use of a dark colour palette of reds, purples and blacks.

Amy’s paintings aim to convey the pure essence or souls of the animals that they represent. Working primarily in bold, flat gouache, the interplay between colour and negative space of her neutral backgrounds is key.

Amy is a Bristol based artist. Originally from Wiltshire, her pastoral upbringing has fuelled her fascination for the natural world. She graduated in 2007 from Falmouth College of Arts with a BA (Hons) degree in Illustration. She has exhibited at Chelsea Flower Show 2007, Grotesques 2010 at Antlers Gallery Bristol and The Royal West of England Academy 2011. Her work is on permanent display onboard the Cunard Queen Victoria.

The piece is from a  series of works based upon the Medusa myth that Ellie produced for Antlers Anatomy show in July 2011. Through the well-known Greek Myth of Medusa the Gorgon Queen Ellie explores and adapts both the anatomy of this formidable character and that of the story surrounding her.

The work deals with entrapment, the female role in storytelling and the close relationship between the beast and the human. Whilst Ellie’s work addresses themes of entrapment it in turn provides the tools for escapism.

Through the work of Ellie Coates the viewer is invited into the timeless world of story telling. Combining inspiration drawn from myths, folklore and Renaissance painting she creates the props with which to encourage the imagination of the viewer to weave the narrative.

name: Hungry for Nectar
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: Hungry for Nectar

Date: 2009

Dimensions: 30 cm x 30 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an acrylic on canvas painting by Tim Lane.

Description:

This painting is from a series of works by Tim Lane called ‘Bacchanalia’ The bacchanalia were wild and mystic festivals of the Roman god Bacchus: the wine god. The term has since come to describe any form of drunken revelry. This series of small scale works takes as loose inspiration this Classical festival of ultimate decadence and animalistic pleasure.

Here, the revellers are seen on their way to a modern fancy dress party wearing costumes and carrying attributes reflective of their own inner hopes, dreams and fears on their journey through life

In ‘Hungry for Nectar’ Tim depicts a young girl on her way to the party with a sinister, murderous intent. He contrasts the sweetness and violence, again using the party masks as a way of revealing a character’s true nature. 

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: The Price of Fame
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: The Price of Fame

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 42 cm x 59 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Tim Lane.

Description:

Created for Antlers first show ‘Grotesques, ‘The Price of Fame’ shows how being ostentatious in your displays of wealth opens you up to predators and parasites.  A play on the story of Beauty and the Beast, this gentleman has literally given his right arm to gain acceptance and attention.  

Tim’s anachronistic style takes especially strong influence from classic literature and mythologies. Although Tim’s background is in illustration he now concentrates on fine art painting and drawing, in which he enjoys greater creative freedom in terms of both style and subject matter. Illustration has however helped to give structure to his love for working directly from his imagination and gives his art its narrative quality. It has also encouraged a passion for drawing, which is at the core of all his work.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration. Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery, ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol. Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

name: Ravens
description:
Artist: Rebecca Hiscocks

Title: Ravens

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 28.5 cm x 37.5 cm

Medium: Solar Plate Etching 

Edition Size: 25

Description: 

Rebecca Hiscocks finds inspiration in the bizarre and the macabre, her intricate and detailed compositions reflect London's uncanny and unusual past. Through a fascination of the internal workings of the body she has recently been researching stories about St Bartholomews and St Thomas hospitals, looking closely at the 18th century etchings of anatomical pioneer William Cheselden in order to inform her visual narrative.

Rebecca uses a combination of architectural decoration and a muted pallet in order to create a softness and beauty as a contrast to the invasiveness of surgery.

Rebecca recently graduated from the University of the Arts, London with an MA in Illustration. She is currently based in London and has been lecturing in illustration and print since 2001. She is currently working with the Wellcome Collection, creating votive paintings in the form of illustrations for members of the public who wish to give thanks to people who have averted disaster in their lives.

name: A Feast of Children
description:
Artist: Mr Mead

Title: A Feast of Children

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 29.7 cm x 42.0 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a dip pen on card drawing by Mr Mead. This print is from a limited edition of 50.

Description:

A scene from the book ‘A Boy in Darkness’ by Mervyn Peake depicting a long deserted banquet hall prompted Mr Mead to create a piece envisioning his own idea of what it would have looked like in its former glory. Within this drawing, Mr Mead reverses the practice of humans eating animals and instead reveals a scene of various different animals enjoying a feast of children.

Mr Mead’s terror and intrigue for animals dressed as humans stems from his childhood. Deciding to embrace his fear, he has developed his ink based style to create dark inhuman characters blending the animal, human and mechanic, a practice he nicknames ‘Bio-Mechanical Anthropomorphism’. 

Working on large pieces of MDF with the smallest medium he can find, a dip pen. Mr Mead cross hatches and stipples until the piece is to his obsessive satisfaction. 

After studying Animation in Bournmouth, Mr Mead went onto develop his traditional drawing practice. He currently works from Jamaica Street Studios in Bristol and regularly exhibits with Antlers, including his solo project - Dark Suits in April 2011. 

Original works by Mr Mead are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

This piece of is greatly inspired by one of Mr Mead’s favorite films ‘Princess Mononoke’, a Japanese anime. name: Voxman
description:
Artist: Mr Mead

Title: Voxman

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 29.7 cm x 42 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a dip pen on card drawing by Mr Mead. This print is from a limited edition of 50.

Description:

Voxman was Mr Mead’s first large-scale character drawing and was made specifically for Antlers first exhibition ‘Grotesques’. The original drawing measures six foot high and took 45 pens to complete. The reason for the scale used in this drawing was to attempt to overcome the artist’s fear of waking up in the night to be confronted by a Fox-man. Mr Mead hoped that by creating a life-sized replication of his nightmare, and staring directly into its eyes, he could conquer it. 

Mr Mead is a Bristol based artist / illustrator who admires the surreal and otherworldly sides of art. Mead hand draws all of his work with fine liner pens and / or dip pen and Indian ink then modifies the work for prints digitally.

Mead’s terror and intrigue for animals dressed as humans stems from his memories of Reginald Mills’ 1976 ballet film, The Tales of Beatrix Potter. Deciding to embrace his fear Mead has recently found a passion for more the traditional artistic techniques and has developed his ink based style to create dark inhuman characters blending the animal, human and mechanic.

description:
Artist: Anouk Mercier

Title: Stag

Date: 2011

Dimensions: 19 cm x 24 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Anouk Mercier.

Description:

Anouk’s drawings rely on the nostalgia of Romanticism, mythology and storytelling to depict melancholic worlds, undefined by time, space or location.

These drawings combine references to vintage postcards with Anouk's own mark making technique, producing images that confuse the boundaries of what is ‘real’.

After studying at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Beaux Arts in Paris, Anouk went on to read Art and Visual Culture at UWE, Bristol. In 2008 she won the Innes Wilkin Art in Architecture Prize and since has gone on to exhibit in a number of group shows including exhibitions at the RWA, Spike Island and the Bristol Drawing School. In June 2011 Anouk had her first solo exhibition at La Galerie, Clamecy, France.

Original works by Anouk are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Anouk Mercier.

Description:

Anouk’s botanical work is partly inspired by her family history as well as her collection of French botanical vintage postcards. She is fascinated by the duality that seems to exist between the cheerful inscriptions inside the postcards and the nostalgia of the black and white lifeless flower arrangements depicted.  Her work is titled by these inscriptions, so the title of this print of dahlias, 'Votre amour fait mon bonheur', can be translated as 'Your love makes me happy'.

In this series of work, Anouk tries to push the limits of beauty until it becomes slightly unnerving or uncanny.

After studying at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Beaux Arts in Paris, Anouk went on to read Art and Visual Culture at UWE, Bristol.  In 2008 she won the Innes Wilkin Art in Architecture Prize and since has gone on to exhibit in a number of group shows including exhibitions at the RWA, Spike Island and the Bristol Drawing School. In June 2011 Anouk had her first solo exhibition at La Galerie, Clamecy, France.

Original works by Anouk are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

description:

Title: Cat (no.1)

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Anouk Mercier.

Description:

Anouk started drawing cats as a response to being asked for the ‘cute’ and ‘commercial’.  She responded by producing these intensely intricate drawings, again inspired by vintage postcards, of fluffy cats.  However, whilst being adorably appealing, these animals still retain their peculiarly feline, eerie quality.

After studying at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Beaux Arts in Paris, Anouk went on to read Art and Visual Culture at UWE, Bristol. name: Chalet (No.6)
description:
Artist: Anouk Mercier

Title: Chalet (No.6)

Date: 2011

Dimensions: 40 cm x 30 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition size: 25

Details:
This limited edition giclée print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of watercolour, colour pencil and graphite on paper drawing by Anouk Mercier.

Description:

This series of chalet pictures demonstrates Anouk’s continuous search for escapism through the portrayal of a fragmented, yet beautiful, ideal, whilst also exploring the mysterious, the abysmal and the uncanny that often lurks behind such idylls.
Celebrating the power of imagination to escape the quotidian and the mundane, Anouk’s drawings prompt the creation of narratives by encouraging the viewer to follow the paths of these fantastical landscapes.

After studying at the Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Beaux Arts in Paris, Anouk went on to read Art and Visual Culture at UWE, Bristol. In 2008 she won the Innes Wilkin Art in Architecture Prize and since has gone on to exhibit in a number of group shows including exhibitions at the Royal West of England Academy, Spike Island and the Bristol Drawing School. In 2011 Anouk had her first solo exhibition at La Galerie, Clamecy, France as well as being awarded the emerging artist prize at the RWA Autumn exhibition. 

Original works by Anouk are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Resting Soul VIII
description:
Artist: Rose Sanderson

Title: Resting Soul VIII

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 21 cm x 29.5 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 20

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a  reproduction of a Acrylic / Mixed Media painting by Rose Sanderson. 

Description:

The things that are generally disregarded in the world around her are of great influence to Rose’s work. Where some may see ugliness, disgust or distaste, Rose sees beauty and intrigue. 

The object of death is seen not as a morbid obsession created to shock or offend but as an appreciation of what once was: to honour and celebrate its existence. Expressive backgrounds that give a feeling of decay (peeling layers of wallpaper, cracked surfaces, aged and ‘distressed’) are combined with fine attention to detail in the subject matter, producing a vibrant mixture of traditional and experimental techniques.

Rose is a Bristol based artist who graduated in 2003 from The University of the West of England with a BA (hons) degree in Illustration. Since then, her work has steadily progressed towards fine art painting, allowing her more creative freedom. She has exhibited in numerous shows spread across Bristol, Bath, London, Plymouth, Glasgow, Amsterdam, Brussels, New York and Singapore.

Original works by Rose are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: The Grand Inquisitor
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: The Grand Inquisitor

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 56.5 cm x 56.5 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Tim Lane.

Description:

The inspiration for this piece came from a character in ‘The Brothers Karamazov’ by Dostoyevsky.  Here one body has taken on the responsibilities of all of humanity, but whilst the people gain support, in return they have given away their autonomy.  They are blissfully ignorant but ultimately powerless. 

Tim’s anachronistic style takes especially strong influence from classic literature and mythologies. Although Tim’s background is in illustration he now concentrates on fine art painting and drawing, in which he enjoys greater creative freedom in terms of both style and subject matter. Illustration has however helped to give structure to his love for working directly from his imagination and gives his art its narrative quality. It has also encouraged a passion for drawing, which is at the core of all his work.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Exchange of Ideas in the Underworld
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: Exchange of Ideas in the Underworld

Date: 2011

Dimensions: 59.4 cm x 42 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Tim Lane.

Description:

This piece is loosely based on a scene from Ovid’s Metamorphoses where the dead in Hades receive news about their loved ones in a marketplace. Here they are exchanging not just news, but ideas. In swapping heads the characters are able to experience and learn things from different perspectives. 

Tim’s anachronistic style takes especially strong influence from classic literature and mythologies. Although Tim’s background is in illustration he now concentrates on fine art painting and drawing, in which he enjoys greater creative freedom in terms of both style and subject matter. Illustration has however helped to give structure to his love for working directly from his imagination and gives his art its narrative quality. It has also encouraged a passion for drawing, which is at the core of all his work.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: The Death of Childhood
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: The Death of Childhood

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 56 cm x 56.5 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an acrylic on canvas painting by Tim Lane.

Description:

This piece is taken from Tim’s ‘Memento Mori’ series, in which he deals with mortality and the inevitability of death; a theme central to much of his work. 

In this particular painting, Tim plays with the idea of the older generation passing on wisdom to the younger in a macabre tableau that uses imagery from the Mexican ‘DÌa de los muertos’ (Day of the Dead). 

Tim’s anachronistic style takes especially strong influence from classic literature and mythologies. Although Tim’s background is in illustration he now concentrates on fine art painting and drawing, in which he enjoys greater creative freedom in terms of both style and subject matter. Illustration has however helped to give structure to his love for working directly from his imagination and gives his art its narrative quality. It has also encouraged a passion for drawing, which is at the core of all his work.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol.  Tim has had two solo shows at Knifesmith Gallery in Bristol ‘The Innocents?’ 2009 and ‘Revelations’ 2010.

Original works by Tim are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Ticking Clock
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: Ticking Clock

Date: 2009

Dimensions: 30 cm x 30 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an acrylic on canvas painting by Tim Lane.

Description:

This painting is from a series of works by Tim Lane called ‘Bacchanalia’ The bacchanalia were wild and mystic festivals of the Roman god Bacchus: the wine god. The term has since come to describe any form of drunken revelry. This series of small scale works takes as loose inspiration this Classical festival of ultimate decadence and animalistic pleasure.

Here, the revellers are seen on their way to a modern fancy dress party wearing costumes and carrying attributes reflective of their own inner hopes, dreams and fears on their journey through life

This image shows the character of the businessman shackled to our self-imposed idea of time, with the ominous rabbit hole looming open behind him.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration.  Notable group exhibitions include Grotesques and Anatomy with Antlers Gallery,  ‘Out of Darkness’ Literary Festival at The Globe at Hay, Hay-on-Wye and ‘Mortal: Life, Death and Memento Mori’ Clifton, Bristol. Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Tim Lane.

Description:

In the story of ‘Faust’ by Goethe, Faust sells his soul to the devil for all the wealth and knowledge in the world. This drawing is Tim’s imagining of the demons coming to collect. With ghoulish faces inspired by voodoo imagery Tim creates an image that is both chilling and menacing. 

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration. name: Punch
description:
Artist: Tim Lane

Title: Punch

Date: 2010

Dimensions: 54.5 cm x 42 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a graphite on paper drawing by Tim Lane.

Description:

Here Tim shows the young children watching Punch trounce the devil as their matronly child minders talk amongst themselves. He explores ideas about a loss of innocence and a lack of care. The character of Punch was often used to voice opinions that would otherwise be prohibited, satirising politicians, for example.  The darker subtext of the material combined with the explicit violence turns this children’s puppet show into something much more sinister. 

Tim’s anachronistic style takes especially strong influence from classic literature and mythologies. Although Tim’s background is in illustration he now concentrates on fine art painting and drawing, in which he enjoys greater creative freedom in terms of both style and subject matter. Illustration has however helped to give structure to his love for working directly from his imagination and gives his art its narrative quality. It has also encouraged a passion for drawing, which is at the core of all his work.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration. In this image the good-natured Dr Jekyll is battling with his younger misanthropic, alter ego, attempting to control him, yet also relying on him as an emotional outlet. Tim’s drawing creates an intense, vital image of the nature of addiction, repression and self-destruction.

Tim graduated from Falmouth College of Arts in 2004 with a first class degree in Illustration. name: Phantom
description:
Artist: Laura Wady

Title: Phantom

Date: 2011

Dimensions: 19.5 cm x 12 cm

Medium: Book

Edition Size: 500

Details:

This limited edition book has 32 pages and a hand screen printed and embossed cover.

Description:

This limited edition book was produced by Laura when she won the Graphic Literature Prize. This prize is given to a first time Author /  Illustrator and awarded buy Atlantic Press and University College Falmouth annually. 

Laura’s interest lies in the notion of ‘grotesque beauty’ (the monstrous feminine), a divinity that is embedded in myth, folklore and story telling. Here she uses watercolour and pencil drawing to create an image that is both delicate and provocative, both sensual and bizarre. 
Laura is currently based in Bristol and has recently taken up residency in a studio at Spike Island. After completing her BA in Design at the University of Plymouth Laura went onto study an MA in Illustration at University College Falmouth. 

Original works by Laura are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Chrysaor
description:
Artist: Ellie Coates

Title: Chrysaor

Date: 2011

Dimensions: 39.5 cm x 39.5 cm

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Innova Soft Textured Natural White Paper 315gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of a pencil drawing by Ellie Coates.

Description:

This piece is from a  series of works based upon the Medusa myth that Ellie produced for Antlers Anatomy show in July 2011.  According to Greek mythology, Chrysaor was the son of Medusa and Poseidon, conceived in the temple of Athena.  Ellie works from her memory of myth, rather than sticking too closely to the original myth, Ellie embellishes and alters, allowing her own imagination free reign when bringing these ancient stories to life through her work. 

Through the work of Ellie Coates the viewer is invited into the timeless world of story telling. Combining inspiration drawn from myths, folklore and Renaissance painting she creates the props with which to encourage the imagination of the viewer to weave the narrative. 

Ellie graduated with a First Class degree in Drawing and Applied Arts at the University of the West of England. 

Original works by Ellie are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Stag.
description:
Artist: Abigail Reed

Title: Stag

Date: 2009

Dimensions: 29.7 cm x 42 cm (A3)

Medium: Giclée Print with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks on Hahnemuhle Museum Etching Paper 350gsm.

Edition Size: 50

Details:

This limited edition giclee print on museum grade archival paper is a reproduction of an ink on paper drawing by Abigail Reed.

Description:

Abigail Reed’s paintings and drawings portray the human and animal form, the strength these figures embody and the impact they have on their surroundings.

Animals poised in their ultimate state, stand like statues demanding your attention. As you look through the layers of pencil, charcoal, ink and paint the medium has been allowed to flow, nothing is fixed. Dripping, bleeding and cracking revealing its accidental, volatile nature, a beginning and an end, from darkness to light. The subjects are exposed, unveiling something primal, vulnerable; penetrating a raw truth.

Abigail received a First class BA Hons in Fine Art from The University Of Wales Institute of Cardiff in 2004 and now works from her Jamaica Street Studio in Bristol. In 2010 Abigail had her first solo exhibition at the Knifesmith Gallery and her solo shows this year include the Folk House Cafe and Urban Outfitters store also in Bristol. Abigail has also recently appeared at No.1 Harbourside, Royal West of England Academy, and JSA Open Studios Weekend. Her previous successes include several Lead Artist shows at Bay Art in Cardiff.

Original works by Abigail are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: White Rose II
description:
Artist: Charles Emerson

Title: White Rose II

Dimensions: 75cm x 56cm

Medium: Photographic Print, printed with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks onto 271gsm Oyster Photo Paper

Edition size :- 50

Description:

Charles creates photographs that experiment with the boundaries between painting and photography. This work captures the moment in which a flower is submerged in water and inks.

Charles' flower series draws on the composition and lighting values of still life paintings. Using water and inks Charles creates photographs that experiment with the boundaries between painting and photography. Influenced by the use of symbolism in Dutch Vanitas, Charles has created his own symbolic imagery, in which he explores ideas of fragility in life, death and the hereafter. 

This work features on Editors' new 2013 album 'The Weight of Your Love'.

More works by Charles are available, to find out more please contact Jack on:

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180

name: Buachaille Etive Mor I
description:
Artist: Charles Emerson

Title: Buachaille Etive Mor I

Dimensions: 85cm x 60cm

Medium: Photographic print, printed with Ultrachrome Pigment Inks onto 271gsm Oyster Photo Paper

Edition size :- 50

Description:

Charles is a technique photographer who explores ideas and methods for producing imagery. His constantly evolving approach creates innovative and captivating projects.

Charles’ Mountain’ images are part of an on-going series in which he photographs the mountains of Glencoe on every passing, no matter what the conditions. With strong family links to the West Highlands.  As Charles ages with each journey, the mountain remains constant but the seasons and conditions change. A digital camera captures the detail, with additional colour achieved using a replica of Charles’ first ever camera, a point and shoot Halina.

Charles’ images are available as limited edition prints. Email the gallery for more information and purchasing enquiries

jack@antlersgallery.com or 0778 050 3180
